intro: Cyathea thelypteroides, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can live for several decades, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its rhizome is thick and fibrous, providing structural support and storing nutrients. The fronds are typically evergreen and can be used in traditional Māori practices.
